intro: Grindelia puberula var. microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed greaseweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellowish-green, sticky resinous leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native range.
